doc:
Charles Fredericks https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Fredericks 0 Charles Fredericks (5 Sep 1918 in Columbus, Mississippi – 14 May 1970 in Sherman Oaks, California) was an American actor of stage, television, and film. He was particularly known for his highly prolific career in B-Western movies and television Westerns during the 1950s and 1960s. He was also a talented Baryton-Martin and starred as Gaylord Ravenal in the 1946 Broadway revival of Show Boat and as Captain Nicholas Gregorovitch in the original 1947 production of Music in My Heart. In more recent years, moviegoers have seen him as the singing King in the "Just You Wait" sequence of the film My Fair Lady (1964). In 1957, Fredericks appeared as "Larkin", along with Chris Alcaide and Jay Novello. in the episode "Small Man" of the ABC/Warner Brothers western television series, Colt .45, starring Wayde Preston. In 1960, Fredericks played Marshal Ed Springer in the Colt .45 episode "The Gandy Dancers". Charles_Fredericks ( 5_Sep_1918 in Columbus , Mississippi – 14_May_1970 in Sherman_Oaks , California ) was an_American_actor of stage_,_television , and film . He was_particularly_known for his_highly_prolific_career in B-Western_movies and television_Westerns during the_1950s_and_1960s . He was also a_talented_Baryton-Martin and starred as Gaylord_Ravenal in the_1946_Broadway_revival of Show_Boat and as Captain_Nicholas_Gregorovitch in the_original_1947_production of Music in My_Heart . In more_recent_years , moviegoers have_seen him as the_singing_King in the_" Just You Wait "_sequence of the_film My_Fair_Lady ( 1964_) . In 1957 , Fredericks appeared as " Larkin " , along with Chris_Alcaide and Jay_Novello . in the_episode " Small_Man " of the_ABC/Warner_Brothers_western_television_series , Colt_.45 , starring Wayde_Preston . In 1960 , Fredericks played Marshal_Ed_Springer in the_Colt_.45_episode " The_Gandy_Dancers_" .
